channel.title: Will there ever be a new datmaker program?
channel.description: just wondering would there ever be a new datmaker program i mean i dont know what they could do to make it better but just wondering.

item.title: Will there ever be a new datmaker program?
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Nope. Mines written in Java simply because then Mac users can use it without needing wine or whatever to run .exe’s.

Read full topic
item.source: Will there ever be a new datmaker program?

item.title: Will there ever be a new datmaker program?
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:31, topic:519038”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=637492.msg4299204#msg4299204 date=1368708053]
@the wanderer if it was an accident they could had easily deleted all database entries and allowed him to remake his account if he so desired to ever come back.
[/quote]
I believe they are allowing him to recreate his account if he wants to come back? Trouble is he doesn’t want to come back.

i dont get what delphi is srry im not that experienced with stuff. is that a programming language? or datmaker was made in that right?

en.wikipedia.org

Object Pascal

Object Pascal refers to a branch of object-oriented derivatives of Pascal, mostly known as the primary programming language of Delphi. Object Pascal is an extension of the Pascal language that was developed at Apple Computer by a team led by Larry Tesler in consultation with Niklaus Wirth, the inventor of Pascal. It is descended from an earlier object-oriented version of Pascal called Clascal, which was available on the Lisa computer.


It’s an old dead language that nobody uses that has a cool ass badge on here that also nobody has.

The reason DatMaker was made in Delphi was because the first model loading program for runescape models was written in Delphi. DatMaker is open source for that same reason. MrP basically just added the functionality of changing .mqo to .dat and vice versa.[/quote]

so do you know delphi? since your working on that new program right?

Read full topic
item.source: Will there ever be a new datmaker program?

item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Loveandpower:

@the wanderer if it was an accident they could had easily deleted all database entries and allowed him to remake his account if he so desired to ever come back.

I believe they are allowing him to recreate his account if he wants to come back? Trouble is he doesn’t want to come back.

hadlich4:

i dont get what delphi is srry im not that experienced with stuff. is that a programming language? or datmaker was made in that right?

en.wikipedia.org

Object Pascal

Object Pascal refers to a branch of object-oriented derivatives of Pascal, mostly known as the primary programming language of Delphi. Object Pascal is an extension of the Pascal language that was developed at Apple Computer by a team led by Larry Tesler in consultation with Niklaus Wirth, the inventor of Pascal. It is descended from an earlier object-oriented version of Pascal called Clascal, which was available on the Lisa computer.


It’s an old dead language that nobody uses that has a cool ass badge on here that also nobody has.

The reason DatMaker was made in Delphi was because the first model loading program for runescape models was written in Delphi. DatMaker is open source for that same reason. MrP basically just added the functionality of changing .mqo to .dat and vice versa.

item.title: Will there ever be a new datmaker program?
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:21, topic:519038”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=637492.msg4298693#msg4298693 date=1368639006]

[quote author=the elve age link=topic=637492.msg4298263#msg4298263 date=1368571741]
@Arcik 1.37c has been out since his last departure.

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=637492.msg4297364#msg4297364 date=1368455734]

[quote author=the elve age link=topic=637492.msg4296853#msg4296853 date=1368377938]
Probably not. Mr Potatohead wrote it, and the staff accidentally deleted his account and never restored it so he won’t return here again.
[/quote]accident? what? lmfao…
[/quote]I don’t know, one of the staff members was deleting accounts for whatever reason and some how his got mixed in the group. I made several attempts to try to restore his account (asking the admins) but typically just got pushed under the carpet along with the other 99 problems here.
[/quote]I heard by more than one person it wasn’t an accident
[/quote]I’m almost positive it was.[/quote]

Datmaker 1.37c - The Latest DatMaker

Coming back to this, he was accidentally banned by one of the admins when fiddelling with the membergroups, nothing was done wrong by him, but must not have been too bothered as he hasn’t been around and asked or anything… ah well.

Read full topic

item.title: Will there ever be a new datmaker program?
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“hadlich4, post:16, topic:519038”][quote author=The Wanderer link=topic=637492.msg4298448#msg4298448 date=1368592057]
Nope. He’s gone for good.
[/quote]
dang thats sad news. whats he do now? he program other stuff?[/quote]
He left because some members were assholes. SWAT iirc and SWAT isn’t even on this site anymore. He tried helping but nobody really appreciated it so he just left. No idea what he does now. Only person I know that still had contact with him hasn’t spoken to him in like 2+ years.

hadlich4:

im attempting to understand what you just said lol im good at trial and error and its what keeps me going on my project so im sure i can figure it out eventually if i feel the need to, thanks again, and you do think he’ll come back?

A file contains bytes which are just 1’s and 0’s in the binary number system. A hex editor converts these to the hexadecimal number system so you edit them more easily and see the values better.

en.wikipedia.org

Hexadecimal

In mathematics and computing, hexadecimal (also base 16, or hex) is a positional numeral system with a radix, or base, of 16. It uses sixteen distinct symbols, most often the symbols 0–9 to represent values zero to nine, and A, B, C, D, E, F (or alternatively a, b, c, d, e, f) to represent values ten to fifteen. Hexadecimal numerals are widely used by computer system designers and programmers. As each hexadecimal digit represents four binary digits (bits), it allows a more human-friendly represen...


So you open the file and look for where it reads for the texture to be loaded. An easier alternative is to just follow the model reading class in the client so you can spot it yourself then just follow which bits have been read until you get to the texture part. From then on it’s just changing the values in the file so it loads a texture onto the triangles on the model. You may have to change the material to be a texture but it has been a while and since the site is down I can’t tell you for sure without looking into the code in the client myself.

Read full topic
item.source: Will there ever be a new datmaker program?

item.title: Will there ever be a new datmaker program?
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

hadlich4:

so i could still add in that lava texture to my models like the one in the picture? what would you do to add it or is that what you meant with the site?

Yeah. You have to open the model file in a hex editor and change some values so it recognizes the triangles as a textured triangle and applies n texture where n stands for the texture number in the cache (0-49 iirc).

Read full topic
item.source: Will there ever be a new datmaker program?

item.title: Will there ever be a new datmaker program?
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

hm well how can i add the textures from the cache to my models? btw thankyou for letting me know this stuff about mrpotatoehead, you think he’d ever come back?

Read full topic
item.source: Will there ever be a new datmaker program?

item.title: Will there ever be a new datmaker program?
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

hadlich4:

i thought rs (like 317’s) couldnt use textures? or you mean to use the textures for other work.

People have only been able to use textures in the cache. If you could pack the textures into the cache then you could. The main problem is there’s no easy way to do it and requires you to use a hex editor just to add textures in. The site that used to show how is down.

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/tutorials/343966-texturing-models-released.html

I found (supposebly) code for texture support for DatMaker written by MrP, but all it did was load it. Couldn’t convert it. For that you would need to have a directory to your cache and be able to pack your textures in. Can only be 128x128 pixels iirc, too.

Read full topic
item.source: Will there ever be a new datmaker program?

item.title: Will there ever be a new datmaker program?
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:6, topic:519038”]I was working on one that could import between .blend, .mqo, and .dat. I got .mqo to work and I stopped when I tried getting lighting and shading vectors to work.

Uses lwjgl. I might finish it up during the summer since I’ll have more time.[/quote][quote=“amy_webb, post:7, topic:519038”]Would be good if you could finish it off, maybe allow it to add textures and proper animations. :P[/quote]

i thought rs (like 317’s) couldnt use textures? or you mean to use the textures for other work.
